returns._0: True if PoolFactory is approved, else false

poolFactories().details: The same PoolFactory address cannot be used twice

approve(address,address,address).notice: Approve a set of factories used in the Protocol.         Router.sol is able to swap any poolFactories currently approved.         Cannot approve address(0) factories.         Cannot aprove path that is already approved.         Each poolFactory has one unique set and maintains state.  In the case a poolFactory is unapproved             and then re-approved, the same set of factories must be used.  In other words, you cannot overwrite             the factories tied to a poolFactory address.         VotingRewardsFactories and GaugeFactories may use the same address across multiple poolFactories.

factoriesToPoolFactory(address).notice: Get the factories correlated to a poolFactory.         Once set, this can never be modified.         Returns the correlated factories even after an approved poolFactory is unapproved.

isPoolFactoryApproved(address).notice: Check if a PoolFactory is approved within the factory registry.  Router uses this method to         ensure a pool swapped from is approved.

managedRewardsFactory().notice: Factory to create free and locked rewards for a managed veNFT

poolFactories().notice: Get all PoolFactories approved by the registry

poolFactoriesLength().notice: Get the length of the poolFactories array

unapprove(address).notice: Unapprove a set of factories used in the Protocol.         While a poolFactory is unapproved, Router.sol cannot swap with pools made from the corresponding factory         Can only unapprove an approved path.         Cannot unapprove the fallback path (core v2 factories).
